result.execSummary:
The defendant Michele Rose Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
$250.00 BAIL WAS APPLIED TO COSTS. Remaining Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Obtain GED or High School diploma.
Mental Health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
No violent contact with any family members.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - STAYED; to be used at Agent's discretion, as well as to the huber or straight time. 1 day credit, if revoked.

Defendant Michele Rose Edwards in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to strike the repeater enhancer. Court grants. Defendant enters a guilty plea to count 1. Court imposed the following:
 
 Court withholds sentence

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*GED or High school diploma 
*No violent contact with any family members
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 90, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours. 1 day credit if revoked 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
